added_lines: {{- $imageBuilt := printf "%s/%s/%s-%s-ceph-rgw:%s" .Values.docker_registry .Values.docker_namespace .Values.kolla_base_distro .Values.kolla_install_type .Values.image_tag }} {{- $imageFull := .Values.image_full | default $imageBuilt }} {{- $storage_interface := .Values.storage_interface | default "eth0" }} {{- $podTypeBootstrap := true }} {{- $node := .Values.node }} apiVersion: batch/v1 kind: DaemonSet metadata: name: {{ $osdName }} spec: template: metadata: annotations: #FIXME Once out of alpha, this should be converted to yaml. pod.beta.kubernetes.io/init-containers: '[ { "name": "update-config", "image": {{ include "kolla_toolbox_image_full" . | quote }}, "imagePullPolicy": {{ .Values.image_pull_policy | quote }}, "command": [ "/bin/sh", "-c", "cp -a /srv/configmap/..data/* /srv/pod-main-config/; STORAGE_INTERFACE={{ $storage_interface }}; F=/var/lib/kolla-kubernetes/ceph-osd/storage_interface; [ -f $F ] && STORAGE_INTERFACE=$(<$F) || true; IP=$(ip addr list {{ $storage_interface }} | grep ''inet '' |cut -d'' '' -f6|cut -d/ -f1); CONF=/srv/pod-main-config/ceph.conf; sed -i ''/^mon host.*/d;/^mon host/d;/^mon addr/d'' $CONF; sed -i ''/^\\[global\\]/a mon host = ''$IP $CONF; sed -i ''/^\\[global\\]/a mon addr = ''$IP'':6789'' $CONF; sed -i ''/^\\[global\\]/a mon initial members = minikube'' $CONF;" ], "volumeMounts": [ { "name": "ceph-rgw-config", "mountPath": "/srv/configmap" }, { "name": "pod-main-config", "mountPath": "/srv/pod-main-config" }, { "name": "ceph-rgw", "mountPath": "/var/lib/ceph/rgw" } ] } ]' spec: hostNetwork: True hostPID: True nodeSelector: kubernetes.io/hostname: {{ $node }} containers: - image: {{ $imageFull | quote }} name: main securityContext: privileged: true env: {{- include "common_env_vars" . | indent 12 }} - name: HOSTNAME value: {{ $node }} volumeMounts: {{- include "common_volume_mounts" $env | indent 12 }} - mountPath: /var/lib/kolla/config_files/ceph.conf name: pod-main-config readOnly: true subPath: ceph.conf - mountPath: /var/lib/kolla/config_files/config.json name: pod-main-config readOnly: true subPath: config.json - mountPath: /var/lib/kolla/config_files/ceph.client.admin.keyring subPath: data name: ceph-client-admin-keyring volumes: {{ include "common_volumes" $env | indent 8 }} - name: pod-main-config emptyDir: {} - name: ceph-rgw-config configMap: name: ceph-rgw secret: secretName: ceph-client-admin-keyring {{- end }}

commit_message:
[WIP]: FIP port forwarding support[3]

This patch expose the API in neutron-lib.

Patch List:
[1] Extend L3 agent extension and necessary works in backend.
[2] Create new service plugin for port forwarding and fulfill db layer
work.
[3] Extend the current fip API.

Change-Id: I8fcd28698cc636b69d9ac6cc85b8767d93f8724b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/35/535635/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PORTFORWARDING = "PORTFORWARDING"

needed for IPv6.

commit_message:
Moved do_execute method to AuditHandler class

Both Continuous and Oneshot audits made same action in
do_execute, so it's a good idea to move it to the base

subject: Drop partition creation with ceph-volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-03 15:43:31.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_utils.py', 'ceph/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charms.ceph/commit/3c7b6b3eee71988076388c19161ae415bde3558a', 'message': "Drop partition creation with ceph-volume

If a block device is due to be used for a LVM PV, don't bother
creating a single partition as its not required and just adds
a layer of complexity.

This also allows partitions or bcache devices to be consumed
as block devices for ceph OSD's.

Change-Id: I6fac0c781e269c229fb4781dd6683a7236d8e960
"}]
commit_message:
Drop partition creation with ceph-volume

If a block device is due to be used for a LVM PV, don't bother
creating a single partition as its not required and just adds
a layer of complexity.

This also allows partitions or bcache devices to be consumed
as block devices for ceph OSD's.

Change-Id: I6fac0c781e269c229fb4781dd6683a7236d8e960
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charms.ceph refs/changes/97/566097/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Initialize a raw block device consuming 100% of the avaliable disk space. luks_uuid = _luks_uuid(dev) dev, return dev
deleted_lines: Initialize a raw block device with a single paritition consuming 100% of the avaliable disk space. partition = _partition_name(dev) luks_uuid = _luks_uuid(partition) if not os.path.exists(partition): subprocess.check_call([ 'parted', '--script', dev, 'mklabel', 'gpt', ]) subprocess.check_call([ 'parted', '--script', dev, 'mkpart', 'primary', '1', '100%', ]) partition, return partition

commit_message:
Allowing Non-IP Traffic in L2 and L3 domains

Non-IP traffic is allowed in L2 and L3 Domains
The default_allow_non_ip setting determines if non-ip traffic is
allowed in Nuage specific L2 and L3 domains.

Change-Id: Ia0a04e3f7893600d5a709b4b8594187e5bc67e9d
(cherry picked from commit f7fb48470d3efcc338ff907be3b66d297a589f1a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/48/561648/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NuageDefaultAllowNonIP: description: To allow non-IP traffic by default type: boolean default: false neutron::plugins::ml2::nuage::nuage_default_allow_non_ip: {get_param: NuageDefaultAllowNonIP}
